title: Madhya Pradesh woman constable beaten to death by husband with baseball bat
content: The Police official says the accused, Virendra Saket, fled the spot after the alleged crime and is currently on the run

title: Court denies bail to two accused in Mirwaiz Moulvi Farooq’s assassination case
content: Bail applications of the accused in Mirwaiz Moulvi Farooq assassination dismissed by TADA Court; accused avoided law enforcement for years

title: Apple stocks dumped in ditches, as key highway remains closed for third week in Kashmir
content: Officials said a 300-metre patch in Udhampur was proving to be a major challenge for the authorities. The area has witnessed landslips and land subsidence in the past three weeks

title: After Indore, patients allege rat bites at Jabalpur medical college; probe launched
content: Jabalpur Collector Raghvendra Singh said that the district administration has issued notices to hospital authorities, seeking a status report on the incident within three days

title: Hyderabad rains: Afzal Sagar erased, flash floods now fill the void
content: Once a major lake, it has vanished under decades of encroachment and neglect; with its natural drainage lost, the area repeatedly faces heavy flooding, the latest having swept away two youth

title: U.S. President Trump dials PM Modi, greets him on birthday
content: PM Modi said he supports the U.S.’ initiatives towards a peaceful resolution of the Ukraine conflict and also aims to strengthen U.S.-India relations

title: Pawan Kalyan calls for strict vigilance on forces trying to create social unrest in A.P.
content: Social media posts and banners that can incite communal tensions should be monitored, he says and sets a target to reduce serious crimes by 33% in a year

title: Solapur Division’s first KAVACH trial run carried out between Dhavalas-Bhalwani
content: Key safety features, including prevention of Signal Passing at Danger, and generation of emergency alerts, tested

title: DYFI alleges violation of norms in allotment of DSC posts in Andhra Pradesh
content: It questions the rationale behind not releasing district-wise, caste-wise cut-offs and denying postings to some candidates who have been issued call letters

title: Masked gang loots bank at Chadchan, after tying up staff
content: The gang carried country-made pistols and other weapons to strike at the SBI branch in Vijayapura district on Tuesday evening

title: India-Pakistan border sees a sharp rise in drone-driven drug smuggling cases
content: There has been a sharp increase in drone sightings and recoveries of narcotics in border districts such as Amritsar, Tarn Taran, Ferozpur and Gurdaspur

title: Diarrhoea in Vijayawada: water sample reports expected in two days, say analysts
content: Of 333 total reported cases, 34 patients are undergoing treatment; all patients are stable and no deaths have been reported so far, says NTR District Collector

title: Expert team constituted to inquire into incident wherein a guidewire was not removed after thyroidectomy surgery
content: Though the patient underwent the surgery on March 30, 2023, it was during a follow-up appointment for thyroid cancer in March 2025 that the guidewire showed up in an Xray

title: Over 1,300 gifts received by Modi to go under hammer from September 17
content: The items are currently on display at National Gallery of Modern Art, in the national capital, where visitors can view them before placing their bids online

title: Truck tech firm to move out of ORR area in Bengaluru to save its employees from traffic snarl
content: Roads are full of potholes and dust, coupled with the lowest intent to get them rectified. Don’t see any of this changing in the next five years, wrote company CEO Yabaji on X

title: Arrested officer amassed wealth 400 times more than income: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Penal measures beyond suspension or dismissal from the job are being pursued to ensure that the officer is held accountable in accordance with the law, the Assam Chief Minister said

title: How will people find parents’ birth certificates: Mamata
content: The CM said that institutional delivery was low till a few years ago and sought to know how people born at their homes would provide birth certificates for the SIR

title: Leadership shake-up in Hyderabad Metro amid phase two integration row
content: L&T Metro Rail Hyderabad (L&TMRH), which built and operates the first phase, offering to sell its equity to the Centre or State instead of agreeing to integrate its existing infrastructure — trains and systems — with the proposed second phase of 76.4 km, estimated to cost ₹24,269 crore across five corridors

title: India’s education sector most vulnerable for cyberattacks: Check Point
content: Organisations in India experienced 3,237 cyberattacks per week in the month of August 2025 while global enterprises faced an average of 1,994 cyber attacks per week in the same month

title: Where are the 41 missing files on theft of idols, Supreme Court asks T.N. govt.
content: Petitioner alleges “serious conspiracy” among ‘police officers, bureaucracy, idol mafia’ and demands fair investigation; judge says truth should be brought out; court seeks FIR on missing files

title: BJP to screen film on PM in all Bihar Assembly constituencies
content: Party leaders flag off vans to screen ‘Chalo Jeete Hain’ at more than 50,000 places in the State to mark Prime Minister’s birthday; State unit will also conduct blood donation and various public service programmes

title:
Change in PMK’s registered address is an attempt to hoodwink people, says 
G.K. Mani
content: The senior leader alleges that the permanent address of the party is at Teynampet, Chennai, but this has been changed in an attempt to hoodwink the people. It amounts to cheating

title: Protests over 19-year-old NEET aspirant’s death rock Gorakhpur
content: Such an incident in the home district of the Chief Minister shows that criminals have no fear of the police, and law enforcement mechanisms, Congress leader Shahnawaz Alam said

title: Mata Vaishno Devi pilgrimage to resume on September 17
content: The decision to resume the yatra comes two days after a group of pilgrims staged a protest at Katra base camp in support of their demand for resumption of the pilgrimage.

title: ‘Can you prove Group 1 posts were sold at ₹3 crore each?’
content: Some of us do not even have a job and some are daily labourers. We took loans to educate our children. Please don’t make your accusations and counter accusations on the unemployed, parents of Group 1 exam rankers said

title: A platform for children to express their dream of social development
content: Kudumbashree’s ‘Dream Vibes’ on October 2 will allow Balasabha children to give voice to their thoughts on how their local community should be

title: No video recording of counting process: Karnataka High Court orders recounting of votes polled in election held to Malur Assembly constituency
content: Court sets aside election of MLA K.Y. Nanje Gowda; directs ECI to take action against District Election Officer for failure to produce video recording

title: World’s largest bamboo-based ethanol plant getting pick of the north east’s grass
content: The balco and tulda varieties, indigenous to the northeastern region, are preferred for their high cellulose content

title: Naidu bats for tech-driven roadmap for governance, law and oder reforms in A.P.
content: All government files must be uploaded online within two months, with forensic auditing tools to prevent manipulation, he says, adding that Data Lake will be operational by November

title: Parliamentary Panel on simultaneous polls to meet economists
content: The panel chairman and senior BJP leader P. P. Chaudhary said that the panel wants to review the economic implications of simultaneous elections.

title: Ekta Samavesha in Hubballi is non-political, says Dingaleshwar Swami
content: The Shirahatti Fakkireshwar Mutt seer is coordinating the Veerashaiva Lingayat Ekta Samavesha in Hubballi

title: Gujarat trains 1.81 lakh artisans under PM Vishwakarma scheme in two years
content: Loan sanctions under the scheme have crossed ₹390 crore for over 43,000 beneficiaries in Gujarat; the scheme covers 18 traditional trades, including carpentry, blacksmithing, pottery, tailoring, masonry, toy making, and basket weaving

title: Siddaramaiah playing Kuruba card for his political survival, alleges BJP MLC Vishwanath
content: ‘Siddaramaiah’s fresh move to revive the proposal to include Kuruba community into the list of Scheduled Tribes (ST) was part of his political design to counter Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar, who was keen on grabbing the Chief Minister’s post’

title: Divergence among Opposition in boycotting House panel on 130th Amendment Bill should have been avoided: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) General Secretary M.A. Baby terms “anti-democratic” the three Bills that allow the removal of Prime Minister, Chief Ministers, and other Ministers after 30 days in custody

title: Prolonged power outage cripples Thrissur City as Corporation electricity staff go on strike
content: The joint trade unions of the Corporation electricity department launched the strike demanding withdrawal of the Local Self-Government department’s order reducing sanctioned posts from 229 to 103, and seeking a salary revision that has been pending for seven years.

title: K.S. Anurag joins Koodalmanikyam temple as Kazhakam worker after prolonged controversy
content: Kerala High Court clears way for appointment; Minister Bindu hails move as a step towards social justice and equality

title: GST rate revision benefits should pass on to common man, says Deputy CM
content: Says that State took decisions in the interests of poor and middle class in spite of losing ₹5,000 crore revenue

title: WB Leader of Opposition submits response in HC on BJP MLAs’ defection to Trinamool
content: Since 2011, nearly 50 Opposition MLAs have defected to the ruling party in West Bengal; none have faced disqualification under the anti-defection law

title: India explores multinational nomination of ‘Chhath’ for UNESCO intangible heritage list
content: The Union Culture Ministry has sought cooperation from senior diplomatic representatives of the UAE, Suriname, and the Netherlands, who welcomed the initiative

title: 70 and still flying high: Idukki woman skydives from 13,000 feet
content: Defying both gravity and convention, Leela Jose, a farmer from Idukki, skydived when she visited her son in Dubai

title: UKP phase-III: Cabinet gives nod for acquisition of 1.33 lakh acres in one go to facilitate Almatti dam height increase
content: Compensation rates for land-losing farmers announced; a total compensation of ₹70,000 crore to be paid over a period of three years

title: Rajnath Singh urges armed forces to be ready for unconventional threats
content: Defence Minister says turbulent global order, regional instability and evolving security landscape demand constant assessment and preparedness

title: On the brink of playoff elimination, Fever are banking on resilience in Game 2
content: The season hasn't gone as planned, but Indiana has built fortitude it hopes will be enough to force a Game 3.

title: NFL: Brady didn't violate rules in Raiders booth
content: Tom Brady did not violate any NFL rules by wearing a headset in the Raiders' coaching booth during Monday night's game, the NFL announced.

title: Source: Vikings RB Jones (hamstring) hits IR
content: The Vikings placed running back Aaron Jones on injured reserve Tuesday because of a hamstring injury, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Astros' Alvarez has significant sprain, out 'a while'
content: Astros slugger Yordan Alvarez has been diagnosed with a "significant" left ankle sprain and will be out of the lineup "for a while," manager Joe Espada said.

title: McVay tore plantar fascia on sideline during win
content: Head coach Sean McVay says he tore his plantar fascia on the sideline while coaching the Rams to victory over the Titans on Sunday.

title: Tigers' Skubal throws bullpen, to start Thursday
content: Detroit Tigers starter Tarik Skubal, the reigning American League Cy Young Award winner, is on track to take the mound on Thursday against the Cleveland Guardians, less than a week after feeling tightness on his left side during his previous start.

title: Dabo defends record following 1-2 start, poll exit
content: After a 1-2 start and a fall out of the Top 25, Clemson coach Dabo Swinney defended his program and addressed critics, saying in part that if the university is "tired of winning, they can send me on my way."

title: Mateer, Beck take over as Heisman favorites
content: Oklahoma quarterback John Mateer and Miami QB Carson Beck are the favorites at various sportsbooks in a wide-open race for the Heisman Trophy.

title: Bills QB Allen likely to wear visor to protect nose
content: Bills quarterback Josh Allen will "probably" wear a clear visor on his helmet to help protect his nose during the team's "Thursday Night Football" game against the Dolphins.

title: 🏀 NBA Future Power Ranks: Where is your team?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: An early look at every Power 4 team
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: 'It's a violent play': Why the rest of the NFL isn't using the tush push
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: The biggest success -- and biggest failure -- for all 30 MLB teams this season
content: Whether your favorite team is headed to October or headed home, all clubs have had something go right ... and wrong.

title: Four rivals, 13 days: Five things we learned from Yankees' key September stretch
content: New York went 7-5 against Houston, Toronto, Detroit and Boston. Did it teach us anything for October?

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- and falling -- after two weeks? Here's our fresh 1-32 Power Rankings poll
content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

title: How farming and family forged Eagles center Cam Jurgens
content: Cam Jurgens led the Eagles to a Super Bowl title while playing with a herniated disc. If that sounds tough, wait until you hear about his dad and a scraggly barn cat.

title: Arsenal show at Athletic that they possess the depth to win UCL
content: Subs Gabriel Martinelli and Leandro Trossard powered Arsenal past Athletic Club on Tuesday, showing off the depth needed to win the Champions League.

title: Champions League recap: 10-man Madrid defeat Marseille, Juve draw with Dortmund
content: Here's how Tuesday's action unfolded. Real Madrid hung on, while Juventus and Dortmund provided entertainment.

title: Bond beyond basketball: Longtime friends Ogwumike, Diggins hope to extend Storm's season
content: Skylar Diggins and Nneka Ogwumike dreamed of playing together, but playoff success in Seattle has been elusive.

title: Rest-of-season rankings: Adams, Jones climb ranks; Jeanty drops
content: Eric Karabell updates his fantasy rankings at every position for the remainder of the season, including his top 100 overall.

title: Paige Bueckers receives Rookie of the Year award on Jennifer Hudson's show
content: The Dallas Wings star is the seventh former UConn player and 16th No. 1 overall draft pick to earn the honor.

title: Takeaways from every NFL Week 2 game: More Baker magic, Mack hurt in Chargers win
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 2.

title: Barnwell picks apart three wild Week 2 endings
content: Bill Barnwell sorts through fourth-quarter fireworks in Giants-Cowboys, Broncos-Colts and Jaguars-Bengals.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Crawford takes over super middleweight; where does Canelo land?
content: Terence Crawford's win over Canelo Alvarez reshapes the 168-pound division. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Ovechkin cereal hits shelves with nods to Capitals star's career
content: 'Ovi's Great Crunch' will be available exclusively at Giant Food stores in the Washington, D.C., area.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Man City eyeing Guéhi
content: Crystal Palace's Marc Guéhi is wanted by clubs such as Liverpool and Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: Trump Extends TikTok Shutdown Deadline Again After Reaching Framework Deal
content: President Donald Trump formally extended the deadline to keep the social media app TikTok available in the United States until Dec. 16, giving time to complete the framework of the deal announced Monday.

title: Israel's Netanyahu Says Qatar Funds Hamas, Strike "Justified"
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday that a strike against Hamas officials in Qatar last week was "justified" by the Gulf state's ties to the group.

title: Maoists Offer "Temporary Suspension Of Armed Struggle", Call For Talks With Centre
content: The banned CPI Maoists, operating from shadows for decades, depleting the country of its life blood, are apparently suing for peace - cornered after sustained crackdown by security forces

title: Charlie Kirk Killing Suspect Charged With Aggravated Murder, Faces Death Penalty
content: Tyler Robinson, the 22-year-old Utah man accused of assassinating activist Charlie Kirk, was charged on Tuesday with aggravated murder, a prosecutor announced, saying Robinson left behind his DNA on the trigger of the rifle that fired the fatal shot.

title: 'If Minor Voluntarily Leaves Guardianship, Case Of Kidnapping Doesn't Arise': Allahabad High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court has observed that if a minor voluntarily leaves lawful guardianship, then a case of kidnapping does not arise.

title: Probe Against Tesla After Parents Say Faulty Door Handles Trapped Their Kids
content: Car safety regulators opened an investigation into possible defects in Tesla doors that have reportedly left parents with children trapped in the back seat and forced to break windows to get them out.

title: 15-Year-Old Girl Drowns After Crocodile Drags Her Into River In Rajasthan
content: A 15-year-old girl drowned after a crocodile dragged her into the Parvati River in Rajasthan's Baran district, while she was filling up her pots with water at the river bank, police said on Tuesday.

title: No Information In Files That Jefferey Epstein Trafficked Women To Others: FBI Chief
content: FBI Director Kash Patel said that there is no "credible information" in law enforcement files that convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein trafficked young women to other individuals.

title: Truck Driver Who Ran Over Indore Pedestrians Was 7 Times More Drunk Than Limit: Cops
content: The 50-year-old truck driver, who ploughed his heavy vehicle into pedestrians on a busy road in Indore, was nearly seven times more drunk than the permissible limit set for drivers, a police official said on Tuesday.

title: Amid Trade Tensions, Negotiations And A Thaw, Trump Wishes PM Modi On Birthday
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi thanked US President Donald Trump for his wishes ahead of the former's 75th birthday, stressing his commitment to bettering India-US ties.

title: BMW Crash Rescuer Says Vehicle Seized By Police, Daily Earnings Hit
content: A van driver who rushed the victims of Sunday's BMW accident to the hospital has claimed that his vehicle has been seized by police for investigation, depriving him of his daily income.

title: Delhi Govt All Set To Roll Out Development Projects On PM Modi's Birthday
content: Chief Minister Rekha Gupta led Delhi government is all set to launch various development projects and welfare initiatives commencing with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 75th birthday on Wednesday.

title: Make In India, Achche Din: As PM Turns 75, A Look At His Iconic Catchphrases
content: Over his decade-long tenure, PM Modi has introduced powerful catchphrases that capture his vision for India's growth, development and social progress.

title: J&K's Vaishno Devi Pilgrimage To Resume On Wednesday After 22-Day Halt
content: The pilgrimage to the Vaishno Devi shrine atop the Trikuta hills in Jammu and Kashmir's Reasi district will resume on Wednesday, subject to favourable weather conditions, the shrine board said.

title: Indian-Origin Barrister Disbarred For Oxford University Medical Degree Lie
content: An Indian-origin lawyer who was found to have misled a UK barrister's chamber by falsely claiming to have studied medicine at the University of Oxford has been disbarred for professional misconduct by an independent tribunal.

title: Delhi Court Raps Centre For Delaying Decision In Allotting Bungalow To Arvind Kejriwal
content: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday pulled up the Centre for delaying its decision in allotting a residential accommodation to former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal in the national capital.

title: Nirmala Sitharaman Recounts When PM Modi Sent His Doctor To Check On Her
content: Ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 75th birthday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared an anecdote about how he ensured her well-being after her first Union Budget speech.

title: Drug-Laden Pak Drones Significant Threat To India's Internal Security: Report
content: A "sharp" spike has been seen in the sightings and recovery of drug-laden drones coming into India from Pakistan across the international border in Punjab over the last four years, posing a "significant" threat to the country's internal security

title: "Stood By Us": Chirag Paswan On PM Modi's Support During Father's Hospital Stay
content: Union Minister Chirag Paswan shared an account of how Prime Minister Narendra Modi supported him when his father late Ram Vilas Paswan was hospitalised.

title: 'Vomiting, low blood pressure': Jair Bolsonaro hospitalised; son confirms 'emergency'
content: Jair Bolsonaro, Brazil's former president, was hospitalized while under house arrest due to severe hiccups, vomiting, and low blood pressure, according to his son Flavio. This health emergency follows Bolsonaro's recent sentencing to 27 years in prison for plotting a coup after his 2022 election defeat.

title: Lessons for founders: Zerodha CEO cites Nvidia chief; says success takes time
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath drew parallels between his firm's journey and Nvidia's, emphasizing the significance of timing and perseverance. Starting with a modest ₹10 lakh investment, Zerodha leveraged free infrastructure and a customer-centric approach.

title: 'Positive, forward looking': India, US to intensify trade deal efforts; what happened in meeting
content: India and the US have resumed trade negotiations, marking the first in-person meeting since the US imposed 50% tariffs. Led by Brendan Lynch, the US delegation engaged in 'positive and forward looking' discussions with Indian officials, aiming for a mutually beneficial trade agreement.

title: Asia Cup row: BJP targets Rahul over Afridi's remarks; Cong hits back with old pic
content: The Asia Cup handshake controversy escalated after India skipped the customary exchange with Pakistan, drawing political reactions. Shahid Afridi criticised PM Modi, praising Rahul Gandhi, while BJP's Amit Malviya questioned Gandhi's loyalties. The PCB filed a complaint with the ICC, alleging misconduct by the match referee, and threatened withdrawal from the Asia Cup 2025.

title: From $1B to $150B: Microsoft’s bet on OpenAI may be best in tech history; reason is ChatGPT
content: OpenAI's restructuring into a for-profit entity is poised to grant Microsoft a substantial equity stake, potentially valued at $150 billion. This follows Microsoft's $13 billion investment, marking a potentially historic tech investment return. The partnership, initially involving profit-sharing units and Azure cloud credits, evolved due to ChatGPT's growth and OpenAI's need for capital.

title: Trump extends birthday wishes to Modi, says PM is doing a 'tremendous job'
content: US President Donald Trump conveyed birthday greetings to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, acknowledging his "tremendous job." Trump shared on Truth Social that Modi expressed gratitude for his support in ending the Russia-Ukraine war. The phone call highlights the continued rapport between the two leaders, with Trump praising Modi's leadership and Modi acknowledging Trump's role in international affairs.

title: Israel vs everyone: An Islamic Nato - Just a dream, or a future force?
content: An Israeli strike in Qatar has revived talks of a Muslim military alliance. Iran condemned the attack and proposed a pan-Islamic bloc. Arab states are questioning US security guarantees. Egypt is pushing for a joint Arab military command. Pakistan wants a task force to monitor Israel. The idea of an Islamic Nato faces challenges.

title: Google AI layoffs: AI contractors asked to leave; workers claim no warning given
content: Google has reportedly laid off over 200 AI contractors amidst disputes over pay and working conditions. These contractors, employed by firms like GlobalLogic, were crucial in training AI models like Gemini. Workers allege the layoffs are retaliation for unionization efforts and concerns about job security, with some filing complaints with the National Labor Relations Board.

title: Asia cup - Pak cancel press conference ahead of must-win clash vs UAE
content: Pakistan's Asia Cup 2025 campaign faces turmoil as they cancelled a pre-match press conference before their crucial game against UAE, escalating tensions after threatening to withdraw from the tournament over a handshake controversy involving India.

title: ITR filing: Has due date been extended beyond Sep 16? What taxpayers should know
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25 due date: The Income Tax Department does not seem to have extended the ITR filing deadline for Assessment Year 2025-26, meaning returns filed after September 16 will be considered belated. While the initial deadline was extended to September 16 due to portal issues, no further extensions have been granted despite ongoing user complaints.

title: Middle East crisis: Israeli army hits military infrastructure at Yemen’s port
content: The Israeli army targeted Houthi military infrastructure at Yemen's Hodeidah port, citing its use for Iranian weapons transfers aimed at attacking Israel and its allies. This action responds to repeated Houthi assaults involving drones and missiles launched towards Israeli territory. Recent strikes also coincided with funerals for Yemeni journalists reportedly killed in earlier Israeli operations.

title: Stephen A. reacts, opens First Take with tribute, after Molly's ESPN exit
content: Molly Qerim has announced her departure from ESPN's 'First Take' after a decade as host, with her final day expected later this year. Stephen A. Smith paid tribute to Qerim, praising her grace and kindness. Qerim expressed gratitude to fans and colleagues, calling her time on the show an honor. ESPN acknowledged her central role in the program's success.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up, late motherhood journey, breaking trauma cycle
content: Gabrielle Union reflects on becoming a mother in her 40s, emphasizing her commitment to healing from generational trauma before having Kaavia. She expresses gratitude for the positive impact motherhood has had on her life, while also acknowledging past struggles with miscarriages and the decision to use surrogacy. Union embraces Dwyane Wade's other children, highlighting the couple's happiness as a family.

title: Charlie Kirk tribute: NFL fans divided; Kaepernick protests revisited
content: Following Charlie Kirk's death, NFL teams' tributes have sparked controversy, drawing comparisons to Colin Kaepernick's 2016 protest. Fans are debating the appropriateness of honoring Kirk while Kaepernick faced criticism for kneeling against racial injustice. Some defend the tributes, while others highlight perceived hypocrisy, igniting discussions about politics, free speech, and the NFL's stance.

title: Jayden Reed goes viral, live from hospital bed, collarbone surgery update
content: Jayden Reed, Green Bay Packers wide receiver, had collarbone surgery. He then went live on Instagram. Reed's message, while under medication, excited fans. He declared the Packers would go to the Super Bowl. The video quickly spread online. Fans found it funny and hopeful. They created memes from his speech. Reed's words became a rallying cry for the team.

title: New record! Rashid creates history; India pacer dethroned for this feat
content: Rashid Khan etched his name in Asia Cup T20I history, surpassing Bhuvneshwar Kumar as the highest wicket-taker with 14 wickets. His achievement came during Afghanistan's match against Bangladesh, where he took 2 crucial wickets. Despite a strong start from Bangladesh, Afghanistan's bowlers, including Rashid, restricted them to 154/5, showcasing their prowess in the tournament.

title: 'Deeply concerned': India at UN condemns Israeli strikes in Qatar; urges dialogue
content: India has voiced strong concerns over Israel's recent attack in Doha, denouncing it as a violation of Qatar's sovereignty. At the UN, Arindam Bagchi emphasized peaceful resolution through dialogue, upholding the UN Charter. PM Modi also spoke with Qatar's Emir, condemning the attacks and reaffirming India's support for regional peace and stability, opposing terrorism.

title: 'Stop buying oil from Russia': Trump warns Europe; asks Zelenskyy to 'make a deal'
content: Donald Trump has urged the European Union to cease oil purchases from Russia amidst the Ukraine war, advocating for a peace deal between Zelenskyy and Putin. He criticized existing European sanctions as insufficient and reiterated his willingness to mediate. Trump also called for NATO allies to sanction China, accusing them of supporting Russia, while notably omitting India from his criticism.

title: Savannah James says, 'It’s hard to not love him', praises LeBron’s family love
content: LeBron James and his wife, Savannah, have been together for over two decades, inspiring many with their love. Savannah has praised LeBron's respectful treatment, highlighting his humility despite his fame. Both have publicly expressed their appreciation for each other, with LeBron crediting Savannah for his success.

title: Madison Beer buzz, fans link her to Herbert, Super Bowl hopes ignite
content: Rumors suggest that Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert is dating pop star Madison Beer. Fans speculate Beer's presence boosts Herbert's confidence and performance. Social media buzzes with jokes and theories about their relationship. Neither Herbert nor Beer has confirmed the romance. Beer's silence fuels further speculation. The hype has turned Herbert into a talked-about player this season.

title: IND vs WI Tests: Full Windies squad announced; chase to captain
content: The West Indies have announced their squad, led by Roston Chase, for the upcoming two-Test series against India. The series, starting October 2nd in Ahmedabad, marks the beginning of India's 2025 home season. Following the West Indies series, India will host South Africa for a full series in November and December.

title: Asia cup: BCCI breaks silence on India vs Pak handshake row
content: Following India's dominant victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup, BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia downplayed the controversy surrounding the team's decision to skip the post-match handshake. Saikia emphasized celebrating India's triumph and disregarding noise from external parties. Captain Suryakumar Yadav stated the decision was aligned with the government and BCCI. India's next match is against Oman on September 19.

title: 'Go beyond traditional war concept': Rajnath to forces; flags 'unconventional threats'
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, addressing the Combined Commanders’ Conference 2025, urged the Armed Forces to prepare for modern warfare, including information and biological threats. He emphasized technology adoption and self-reliance, calling for a 'Sudarshan Chakra' strategy. Singh highlighted the 'JAI' mantra (Jointness, Aatmanirbharta, Innovation) for military modernization and cited Operation Sindoor as an example of India's growing indigenous capabilities.

title: Delhi BMW crash explained: What happened that day - in graphics
content: A BMW crash in Delhi's Dhaula Kuan resulted in the death of finance ministry official Navjot Singh and critically injured his wife, Sandeep Kaur. Gaganpreet Makkad, the alleged driver, has been arrested and faces charges including culpable homicide. Kaur alleges Makkad delayed medical assistance, leading to further investigation into the circumstances surrounding the incident and the subsequent care provided.

title: 'They say it's bilateral issue': Pak minister reveals how India rejected any US involvement
content: Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar acknowledged India's refusal of third-party mediation for the ceasefire established on May 10. Dar stated that India insists on bilateral talks, a stance reiterated during a meeting in Washington. He emphasized Pakistan's openness to dialogue, while noting India's reluctance.

title: SC to UGC on caste discrimination: Consider stakeholder suggestions; notify rules in 8 weeks
content: The Supreme Court is actively incorporating the voices of Radhika Vemula and Abeda Salim Tadvi into the UGC's regulatory framework, addressing campus discrimination. The court directed the UGC to consider their suggestions, focusing on accountability, redressal, and mental health support. These suggestions aim to prevent discrimination and ensure equal opportunity, with penalties for institutional negligence.

title: NFL in spotlight after deleting Justin Herbert video with offensive gesture
content: Before the game on September 15, 2025, a video surfaced of Justin Herbert making a questionable hand gesture, which the NFL quickly deleted from its X account. Despite the controversy, Herbert led the Los Angeles Chargers to a 20-9 victory over the Las Vegas Raiders, throwing for 242 yards and two touchdowns.

title: Queen Camilla opts out of Duchess of Kent funeral due to acute sinusitis
content: Katharine, the Duchess of Kent, has died at 92. The funeral is scheduled at Westminster Cathedral. King Charles and royal family members will attend. Queen Camilla will not be present due to sinusitis. She is resting at Windsor Castle. She hopes to recover for American President Donald Trump's state visit. She will play a key role during the visit. Read below!

title: Exclusive: R Ashwin poised for ILT20 stint with possible player-coach role
content: Ravichandran Ashwin may soon be seen in the ILT20 League. ILT20 CEO David White has expressed strong interest in having Ashwin play. White highlighted Ashwin's exceptional talent and cricket intellect. Ashwin has retired from the IPL and is keen to explore opportunities in other leagues. He is also open to coaching roles. Ashwin has registered for overseas leagues.

title: 'Masood Azhar's family torn into pieces': JeM commander's big admission on Op Sindoor
content: Jaish-e-Mohammad commander Masood Ilyas Kashmiri admitted in a video that India's Operation Sindoor severely impacted Maulana Masood Azhar's family. The strike on May 7 targeted terror infrastructure in Bahawalpur, JeM's headquarters, following the deadly Pahalgam attack where 26 civilians were killed. India retaliated by destroying major terror hubs and air infrastructure across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: No Neeraj! Two Indians to compete against Nadeem - Here's why
content: Neeraj Chopra begins his World Championship title defence, facing strong rivals like Arshad Nadeem and Julian Weber. The competition features a historic four Indian athletes. Chopra aims to join an elite group of javelin throwers, while Weber enters as a favourite based on current form. The anticipated Chopra-Nadeem clash is set for the final round.

title: Travis Kelce trolled, bizarre behavior slammed, fans roast ‘tone-deaf’ support
content: The Kansas City Chiefs faced backlash after players wore "Free 4" shirts supporting Rashee Rice, suspended for a high-speed crash that injured four. Fans and analysts criticized the team's public display of loyalty, deeming it tone-deaf given the severity of Rice's actions and his initial lack of remorse. The incident sparked a public relations nightmare, overshadowing the game itself.

title: Vijay’s TVK slams Shah for Hindi 'imposition'; terms it against federalism
content: Actor Vijay's Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) has strongly condemned Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks promoting Hindi, viewing it as an imposition that undermines federalism. The party argues that prioritizing Hindi in government administration disregards the nation's linguistic diversity and goes against the spirit of inclusivity. TVK urges Shah to retract his statement emphasizing Hindi's role in a self-reliant India.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
